# Creat a function called CorrTS that will create 2 correlated time series with a defined correlation and a defined mean and sd of abundance
```{r}
library("MASS", lib.loc="C:/Program Files/R/R-3.5.2/library")

CorrTS<-function(d,a,b){
species<-c(1:2)


ES3<- matrix(d, nrow = max(species), ncol = max(species))
diag(ES3) <- 1
ES3
sd<-rep(a, times=2)
mu <- rep(b, times=2)
covMat <- sd %*% t(sd) * ES3
dat <- mvrnorm(n = 212, mu = mu, Sigma = covMat, empirical = TRUE)
dat
}
```
#Set up a loop to bind tgether lots of data like this
```{r)
library("plyr", lib.loc="C:/Program Files/R/R-3.5.2/library")
g<-vector("list",1)
for (i in 1:25){g[[i]]<-data.frame(CorrTS(-.7,.5,10))}
h<-dplyr::bind_cols(g)
```
